results.question: In triangle ABC with coordinates A=(-7, -10), B=(-2, -3), and C=(-3, -6), find the measure (in degrees) of angle ABC.
results.model_answer: The measure of angle \( ABC \) is approximately \boxed{17.1} degrees.

results.question: For triangle with vertices A=(-1, -6), B=(4, 1), and C=(-7, 4), determine the orthocenter (intersection of altitudes).
results.model_answer: The orthocenter of the triangle is located at the point \boxed{\left( \dfrac{7}{23}, -\dfrac{28}{23} \right)}.

results.question: Find the incircle radius of triangle ABC whose vertices are A=(6, 7), B=(-7, -5), and C=(2, -3).
results.model_answer: The inradius of triangle ABC is approximately \boxed{2.18}.
results.metadata: {'A': (6, 7), 'B': (-7, -5), 'C': (2, -3), 'incircle_radius_exact': 'sqrt(-sqrt(29) + sqrt(85)/2 + sqrt(313)/2)*sqrt(-sqrt(313)/2 + sqrt(85)/2 + sqrt(29))*sqrt(-sqrt(85)/2 + sqrt(29) + sqrt(313)/2)/sqrt(sqrt(85)/2 + sqrt(29) + sqrt(313)/2)', 'incircle_radius_approx': 2.176123777286009}
